activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A Mills

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Preliminary hearing/arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:15 PM Defendant Jacob A Mills appeared by video.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared by video for Jacob A Mills.  Attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Info not filed yet.  Court modified bond conditions: Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance. No operation of a motor vehicle unless absolutely sober. Matter referred to Branch 2 for scheduling of arraignment.
Cannot operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, without insurance or after consuming any alcohol or controlled substances.  .
Adjourned initial appearance on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Maintain absolute sobriety. No driving whatsoever during pendency of action. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

3:56 PM Defendant Jacob A Mills appeared by video.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Jacob A Mills.  Attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $3000 with conditions..  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Maintain absolute sobriety. No driving whatsoever during pendency of action. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
